intro: Lasiandra thereminiana, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is a small shrub that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
